page.title: 18HIGHEST POINT IN KENT.
page.content: We interviewed Mr. Hall who lives on the highest point in Kent. The highest point in Kent is near Westerham Heights which is slightly higher than the highest point in Greater London. He lives in a bungalow which he and his brother-in-law built about 4 years ago. It is about 824 ft above sea level. From his house he can see for about 30 or 40 miles. He likes living on the highest point in Kent very much. He gets quite a few visitors in the summer because they all come to see the highest point in Kent and his workshop is a napoleonic fort so he gets quite a lot of people come to see that as well. The trig point was moved by the O.S. people basically because it would be in the middle of his living room and they moved it to match up with all their other trig points.
